title: Definitions
context: ARTICLE 12 MASS MERCHANDISING OF INSURANCE ยง431:12-101 Definitions. As used in this article: &ldquo;Employees&rdquo; includes compensated officers, managers, and employees of a firm, corporation, partnership, sole proprietor, trust, estate, or members of an unincorporated association or nonprofit organization. A mass merchandising agreement may provide that the term &ldquo;employees&rdquo; shall include retired employees and the individual proprietor, partners, or trustees, if the employer is an individual proprietor, partnership, trust, or estate. &ldquo;Employer&rdquo; includes any firm, corporation, partnership, sole proprietorship, trust, estate, and unincorporated association or nonprofit organization; it also includes the State, any county, any municipal corporation, and any governmental unit, agency, or department thereof. &ldquo;Insurer&rdquo; means an insurer authorized to transact the business of motor vehicle, property, and casualty insurance in the State. &ldquo;Mass merchandise&rdquo; means to sell and &ldquo;mass merchandising&rdquo; means a sale of insurance wherein: (1) The insurance is offered to employees of particular employers, and (2) The employer has agreed to, or otherwise affiliated itself with, the sale of such insurance to its employees. &ldquo;Mass merchandising agreement&rdquo; means an agreement between an insurer and an employer for the sale of insurance to the employees of the employer on a mass merchandising basis. &ldquo;Mass merchandising plan&rdquo; or &ldquo;plan&rdquo; means a program, design, or scheme of the insurance to be mass merchandised, including terms, coverages, and premiums. &ldquo;Motor vehicle&rdquo; means a vehicle of a type required to be registered under chapter 286, including a vehicle with less than four wheels or a trailer. &ldquo;Motor vehicle insurance&rdquo; means an insurance policy and optional additional insurance as defined in article 10C. [L 1987, c 347, pt of ยง2; am L 1997, c 251, ยง55; am L 2003, c 212, ยง100]
